text.div:
This code system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/endpoint-payload-type defines the following codes:

Code Display Definition
any Any Any payload type can be used with this endpoint, it is either a payload agnostic infrastructure (such as a storage repository), or some other type of endpoint where payload considerations are internally handled, and not available
none None This endpoint does not require any content to be sent; simply connecting to the endpoint is enough notification. This can be used as a 'ping' to wakeup a service to retrieve content, which could be to ensure security considerations are correctly handled

name: EndpointPayloadType
description: This is an example codesystem defined by the FHIR project, it represents global concepts for no content, or any unrestricted content.

concept.definition: Any payload type can be used with this endpoint, it is either a payload agnostic infrastructure (such as a storage repository), or some other type of endpoint where payload considerations are internally handled, and not available

This endpoint does not require any content to be sent; simply connecting to the endpoint is enough notification. This can be used as a 'ping' to wakeup a service to retrieve content, which could be to ensure security considerations are correctly handled
